Questions: How do you output a variable value inside JSX
Answers: By wrapping the variable in curly braces: {variableName}

Questions: What is the correct file extension for a React component that uses JSX
Answers: .jsx or .tsx

Questions: What is the children prop
Answers: A special prop that contains whatever content is passed between the opening and closing tags of a component

Questions: Which hook is used to handle side effects like fetching data
Answers: Which hook is used to handle side effects like fetching data

Questions: What is the syntax to import a CSS file in a React component
Answers: import './App.css';

Questions: How do you handle a click event in React
Answers: Using the onClick attribute

Questions: What is the default port for a Create React App server
Can you return multiple elements from a component without a wrapper div
Answers: Yes, using Fragments (<></> or <React.Fragment>)

Questions: What is the purpose of className in React
Answers: It is used to apply CSS classes

Questions: What does npm start usually do in a React project
Answers: It runs the app in development mode

Questions: Is React a framework or a library
Answers: It is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces

Questions: What is the main entry file in a standard React application
Answers: Usually index.js or main.jsx

Questions: What is the rule regarding component names
Answers: They must start with a capital letter

Questions: How do you access a DOM element directly
Answers: Using the useRef hook

Questions: Can you use class as an attribute name in JSX
Answers: No, you must use className because class is a reserved keyword in JavaScript

Questions: What is "One-way data binding"
Answers: Data flows down from parent to child via props

Questions: How do you export a component as the default export
Answers: export default ComponentName;

Questions: What is the purpose of package.json
Answers: It tracks dependencies, scripts, and project versioning

Questions: Can a parent component change the state of a child component directly
Answers: No, not directly; it must pass data via props or use a ref

Questions: How do you comment out code inside JSX
Answers: {/* This is a comment */}

Questions: Explain "Lifting State Up"
Answers: Moving shared state to the closest common ancestor of the components that need it

Questions: What is the difference between useEffect and useLayoutEffect
Answers: useEffect runs asynchronously after the render is painted to the screen; useLayoutEffect runs synchronously after DOM mutations but before the paint

Questions: What is a "Controlled Component"
Answers: An input form element whose value is controlled by React state (single source of truth)

Questions: What is the purpose of React.memo
Answers: It is a higher-order component that memoizes a functional component, preventing re-renders if props haven't changed

Questions: How do you create a "Custom Hook"
Answers: By creating a JavaScript function whose name starts with "use" and that calls other hooks

Questions: What is the issue with using an array index as a key
Answers: It can negatively impact performance and cause issues with component state if the list order changes

Questions: What is the cleanup function in useEffect
Answers: A function returned by the effect that runs before the component unmounts or before the effect re-runs

Questions: What is useReducer used for
Answers: It is an alternative to useState for managing complex state logic involving multiple sub-values or when the next state depends on the previous one

Questions: How do you implement "Lazy Loading" in React
Answers: Using React.lazy() and wrapping the component in <Suspense>

Questions: What is the "Rules of Hooks"
Answers: Hooks can only be called at the top level (not inside loops/conditions) and only from React functions

Questions: How do you force a component to re-render
Answers: By changing its state or props

Questions: What is the difference between Link (from React Router) and a standard <a> tag
Answers: Link updates the URL and renders the new view without reloading the page; <a> causes a full page refresh

Questions: How do you handle error boundaries in functional components
Answers: You can't directly; you must use a Class component or a library like react-error-boundary

Questions: What is "Batching" in React
Answers: React groups multiple state updates into a single re-render for better performance

Questions: How do you pass a parameter to an event handler
Answers: Using an arrow function

Questions: What is the significance of the key prop
Answers: It helps React identify which items have changed, are added, or are removed, optimizing the reconciliation process

Questions: What is the difference between super() and super(props) in class components
Answers: super(props) allows you to access this.props inside the constructor; super() alone does not

Questions: Can you use async/await directly in the useEffect callback
Answers: No, because useEffect expects a cleanup function or nothing returned, but async functions return a Promise. You must define an async function inside the effect and call it

Questions: How do you implement a "Dark Mode" toggle
Answers: Typically using a Context provider to hold the theme state and passing the current theme to styled components or CSS classes

Questions: Explain "Dependency Injection" in the context of React
Answers: Passing services or data sources as props (or via Context) rather than importing them directly, making components easier to test

Questions: Explain the React "Fiber" architecture
Answers: It is the internal reconciliation engine in React 16+ that enables incremental rendering, allowing React to pause, abort, or prioritize work.

Questions: What is "Reconciliation"
Answers: The process of diffing the Virtual DOM with the previous one to determine the most efficient way to update the Real DOM

Questions: How does React handle "Synthetic Events"
Answers: React uses a single global event listener (Event Delegation) at the root and wraps native browser events in a cross-browser wrapper called SyntheticEvent

Questions: What is "Concurrent Mode"
Answers: A set of features that help React apps stay responsive by rendering trees without blocking the main thread

Questions: How does Server-Side Rendering (SSR) differ from Static Site Generation (SSG) in the context of Hydration
Answers: SSR builds HTML on-demand per request; SSG builds it at compile time. Hydration is the client-side process where React attaches listeners to that pre-rendered HTML

Questions: What is the "Tearing" problem in UI
Answers: A visual inconsistency where the UI shows different values for the same state simultaneously

Questions: What is "Suspense" and how does it work internally
Answers: Suspense allows components to "wait" for something (like data) before rendering. Internally, the child component throws a Promise, which React catches to show a fallback until the Promise resolves

Questions: Why shouldn't you update state during rendering
Answers: It causes an infinite loop of re-renders

Questions: What is the difference between React.createElement and JSX
Answers: JSX is syntactic sugar that gets compiled (transpiled) into React.createElement calls

Questions: Explain "Inversion of Control" in React
Answers: Instead of a component controlling its child's logic, it accepts a "render prop" or function child, giving control back to the consumer of the component

Questions: What is "Automatic Batching" in React 1
Answers: React 18 batches state updates inside promises, timeouts, and native event handlers, which previous versions did not do

Questions: How do you implement an "Error Boundary" that catches async errors
Answers: Standard Error Boundaries do not catch async errors. You must implement a custom global error handler or use window.onerror / unhandledrejection listeners

Questions: What is the "Higher-Order Component" (HOC) naming convention
Answers: HOCs usually start with with (e.g., withRouter, withAuth)

Questions: What is "Portals" event bubbling behavior
Answers: Even if a portal renders outside the parent DOM, the React event tree still propagates events to the React parent component, not the DOM parent

Questions: How do you optimize a context that changes frequently
Answers: Use libraries like Recoil/Zustand, or optimize by memoizing the Context value and splitting Contexts

Questions: What is the "Dispatcher" in React internals
Answers: The internal mechanism that keeps track of which hook implementation (mount vs update) should be used during rendering

Questions: Explain the "Observer Pattern" in Redux
Answers: The Store holds state; the View subscribes to the Store; when state changes, the Store notifies all subscribers to update

Questions: What is the difference between hydration and rendering
Answers: Rendering creates DOM nodes from scratch; Hydration attaches event listeners to existing DOM nodes generated by the server

Questions: How can you memoize a component that accepts a React Node (children) as a prop
Answers: It is difficult because children is essentially a new object/array on every render. You often shouldn't memoize wrapper components for this reason

Questions: What is "Tree Shaking"
Answers: A build optimization step (usually by bundlers like Webpack/Rollup) that removes unused code from the final bundle
